initiative_description: AI simulation (agentic AI + synthetic ‘digital personas’) to replicate wealth/asset-management market research in ~1 day, achieving ~90% median correlation vs a full global survey that typically takes ~6 months.
notes: EY partnered with AI simulation startup Aaru (Aug 2025). Described as a strategic-insight method for wealth/asset managers (not a single named client deployment). Key stats cited: 90% median correlation across 53 questions / 3,600 respondents; can simulate ~100,000 agents in hours.

initiative_description: 29th Global CEO Survey (Jan 2026) reporting that 56% of CEOs saw no AI impact on revenue or costs in the prior 12 months; 30% reported increased revenue from AI and 26% reported decreased costs (12% reported both).
notes: The WARC piece (23 Jan 2026) summarises PwC’s 29th Global CEO Survey and frames it around ‘useful’ AI and marketing’s comparatively visible impact. Treat as macro evidence rather than a single-company implementation case.

organisation: OECD (Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development)
initiative_description: OECD Science, Technology and Industry Working Paper 2026/01 analysing firm adoption of AI, big data analysis, internet of things, robotics and 3D printing across 15 OECD member countries (2017–2023), identifying seven stylised facts about diffusion and productivity associations.
notes: Cross-country microdata study (Calvino, Costa, Haerle). Useful for baseline diffusion/adoption metrics and ‘enablers’ (skills, digitalisation, enabling tech like cloud/CRM/ERP), not a specific organisational AI implementation.
